channel.title: Iron Golem thing
channel.description:
From this thing: http://www.minecraftwiki.net/wiki/Iron_Golem
It looks like this 'iron farm' is a legitimate part of the game as designed by mojang, so why should we be wanting to 'combat' it? If we do decide to combat it, how would we do that? Simply disable Iron Golems all together?

item.title: Iron Golem thing
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I don’t think you can enable fake ores, am I missing it?

GitHub

lishid/Orebfuscator

Orebfuscator - The definitive Anti X-Ray plugin for CraftBukkit

Look at this page, it seems that some types of xray can still be used unless I do as it suggests, which would have the, I think bad, side effect that ore wouldn’t be shown even if exposed unless you hit it:

GitHub

lishid/Orebfuscator

Orebfuscator - The definitive Anti X-Ray plugin for CraftBukkit

edit:
Also note it’s not enabled on the creative world as there is no reason for it to be.

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Golem thing
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Doesn’t look like it…

If fake ores aren’t configured to show then it must not be working. I suppose you could say it works decently, but it doesn’t stop all ore being shown, but a large percentage. It’s an improvement!

I think we should also enable fake ores just to waste their time.

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Golem thing
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

[quote=“Tom_BETA, post:13, topic:441988”][quote author=zuppers link=topic=544647.msg3995159#msg3995159 date=1337173508]

AGL tested the anti x-ray and said it did not work. He still saw everything.

[/quote]It works, for example there may be 6 iron ores but it will render exposed ones in range for sure. As for diamond ores I saw none using the xray mod Tom linked to. There doesn’t seem to be any performance issues with it on my end either.

Edit: also agl is a idiot.

I thought you called me mod tom for a moment then, went into a state of confusion as to how my name bares any resemblance

The bottom line is, whereas it may stop other modifications xraying, it doesn’t stop the one I posted which was the first result on Google so it’s still an issue unless theres some weird method which shows fake ores or whatever…[/quote]It does stop the one you posted lol. There’s only one method of xray.

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Golem thing
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Can anyone confirm or deny if the anti-xray is working?

It looks like it’s working, I’ve just installed:

http://www.minecraftmine.org/x-ray-mod-1-1/

and when I xray I see this:

antixrayres.png857×479

It looks like it’s removed most ores, but some are still showing, unless it just generates them to throw the xrayers off? No idea how this thing works

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Golem thing
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

There appears to be another bug as well, I was reading #mopar before and someone shared this:

[Album] Imgur

I’m not sure if it works, or has been patched, or even if they were just trolling. I’ll check it out later if nobody else has. EDIT - Oh man, it works, produces TONS of powered rails =/

Tarkoff:

Sneekey… But how to prevent this

Eh, that’s a pretty good question, I’ve been too caught up explaining the issue that I haven’t really considered an appropriate solution. I think right now the best solution would be to disable golems until we can figure out something else.

As for the track one, assuming it works, nobody seems to have realized it yet so I think if we keep quite about it we should sail smoothly until it’s patched by Jeb. I honestly can’t think of a solution for that.

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Golem thing

item.description:

Sneekey… But how to prevent this

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Golem thing
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Look, this isn’t an iron farm, it’s an iron exploitation - this requires no villagers, no nothing, just a brain and the ability to create some simple redstone circuits. It allows you to produce hundreds of golems an hour from 4 iron blocks and a stable supply of pumpkins.

(lets assume we’re talking ~400 golems) In reality, doing this SHOULD cost you 1.2k iron blocks but it only costs you 4 iron blocks to produce as many, which is a huge profit considering the 4 iron blocks never run out like they do. I’m not sure how the golem creation works, but when Minecraft goes to remove the iron blocks that were used to create the golem the redstone kicks in and does some hackery with it so the 4 blocks remain and the golem is produced.

This done at high speeds with the redstone = a huge amount of golem production from 4 iron blocks. You can produce like 2golems/second and easibly AFK at it, as they fall into lava and drop iron and you’re at no loss what so ever. You can pick your iron blocks back up when ever you please.

Also note, that’s all with just one small circuit, done on a slightly bigger scale would produce so many golems at no loss to you.

An unfinished model I was making on SP, doesn’t work, but you get the gist of the design:

mcdupe.png854×481

I was copying the design, while in a res in which the people who hold the greatest of hatred towards me live. The hole is where they fall, and in the hole there is a mob killer using lava/ladders to kill them really quickly, the water current then channels the loot to an AFKable point.

Read full topic

item.title: Iron Golem thing
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

No I mean the spawn egg for the villagers which are required to farm the golems.

item.title: Iron Golem thing
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

zuppers:

Hmm…I’m not sure what my stance on this is, if it’s a legitimate farm meaning the spawn eggs were not smuggled into another world from creative then I don’t really have a problem with it.

According to the same article, there is no ‘spawn egg’ for a golem.

Phaze One:

From what i’ve seen from youtube, golem farming has been patched in 1.2.5. They now spawn considerably less (almost none at all) and it’s almost impossible to set up a practical iron farm. Regardless i’m not 100% sure of this as I haven’t tested it myself, but considering there are only a handful of people who have villagers (The people who live in the W1 castle and Agl) I can’t see it being an issue.

Tom has been saying people are exploiting some iron farm thing with golems, maybe it’s something else?

Read full topic
